website_summaries.verdict: This model offers stable and accurate pH measurements, but you'll have to calibrate it periodically.
pros: Carrying case and detailed instructions included
Large LCD display for easy reading
cons: Requires regular calibration in order to get an accurate reading

customer_reviews.title: Fail...
customer_reviews.text: Was good for about 6 weeks. It will no longer maintain calibration. I've sent several emails to Apera and left 2 voice messages with no response.. A company can offer any warranty they want especially when they won't back it up.. Sadly this ph pen & Apera are a FAIL
customer_reviews.author: Bryan.S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome until it just stopped working!!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was going to love it!! It was easy to use and came in a nice case and way nicer than that cheaply yellow thing I bought starting out. This held its accuracy as I checked it each time with the solutions I had. I even bought the storage solution for when it was not in use. I pulled it out for the 4th time since purchased in Oct 2018 and it doesn’t turn on. It has a auto shut off but I tried new batteries anyway and no luck. I’ll update my review based on customer service as this is suppose to have a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L. Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome and failed rapidly - a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to measure the pH of liquids for various applications. It did work initially and I stored it carefully, as recommended in the somewhat-confusing instructions that are included. (They are badly translated from Chinese, as near as I can tell.) On my third use, perhaps four months after purchase, I found that the device was no longer able to give a stable and reliable reading, with the displayed reading moving randomly up and down even after several minutes immersed in the liquid. It is of no use to me now. I recommend that you invest in a higher-quality product than this unit. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: T Austin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has been great in sending me 2 replacements but the first 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: These meters are trash. Amazon has been great in sending me 2 replacements but the first 2 arrived damaged, the 3rd one worked for about a week or so but now it wont calibrate to the 4.0 solution. It just says er1. Very disappointing being that i thought i was stepping up in quality and price, turns out it was just a step up in price.
customer_reviews.author: StraightUpReviewsTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: This was used, not new?
customer_reviews.text: I just received my meter, this thing is used, NOT BRAND NEW!! The solutions have both been opened, liquid has leaked out into the case, I can see where the foil was removed, God knows how long ago? I thought I was buying a new meter, not someones used one. Seems like an awesome meter but I didnt pay for a used one and half used calibration solutions. What's up Amazon?? Just shipping anything out and hoping people take it?? Where is the quality control?
customer_reviews.author: Smoknjofus

customer_reviews.title: This is the best one so far
customer_reviews.text: this is the third type of pH meter I have used over the past 6 years for my small pickling business. This is the best one so far! Easy to calibrate, easy to use and results are consistent. Time will tell on durability, but so far, so great!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: POOR QC. Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this meter. The first one worked great. This one fluxuates from 5-10 PH. Not going to return it as my time is worth more than the $48.00 I paid for it. Will NOT purchase again. Quality control is obviously not a concern of this company. This meter should have never made it to market. Stay clear of this product.
customer_reviews.author: tim

customer_reviews.title: Used and wet inside
customer_reviews.text: Received the product that had already been opened and used. Everything was wet inside and I’ll be sending it back. So disappointing 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Trip

customer_reviews.title: All of the calibration fluid that came prepackaged was not ...
customer_reviews.text: All of the calibration fluid that came prepackaged was not sealed correctly causing all of the liquid to leak out during shipping
customer_reviews.author: Devin Robison

customer_reviews.title: Would not even power up
customer_reviews.text: This item would not power on when the (new) batteries were inserted. Close inspection looks like dirt or early corrosion on the contacts but it should not have been bad enough to prevent powering on. This unit may have had other quality issues. The LCD screen is starting to detach in the upper left corner. Very disappointing, returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Meter in Price  Range
customer_reviews.text: I buy meters, like everyone else, wondering why I am always buying new ones in the middle of of the "Season". So, I am repeating the purchase of this meter, because it it very good , when compared to all the others I have owned. This meter has a better protective probe shield built into it. My last one of these did not. Consequently the probe broke, it is very delicate. I used the replacement meter for an entire "Season", and it reads the "calibration solutions" , right on the money. This is my 3d Apera Instruments AI209.But I am very Satisfied overall with this meter. I am a repeat Apera customer.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: cheap foreign junk, and I say foreign because Amazon will censor me if I say the "C" word. Useless right out of the box. after a week I was kicking myself for trying to save money. went with the American made Hanna combo meter, slightly pricey but saved a ton in piece of mind
customer_reviews.author: DiazNutz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the one! I had bought one of those yellow ph meters. I'll just say it was worthless. So I ordered the one everyone said to buy the Apera PH20. This one is awesome. I opened it up read the instructions how to calibrate it was so simple and the buffer liquid is included. After quick calibration I put it to use. It turns on quickly and returns the PH value and displays a smiley to show its good reading. The autocalibration is great, no turning a little screwdriver. Overall it's a great ph meter at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: or worse, they begin to fail when many reading are ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this pH meter when investigating streams. I have used many different brands, and usually they don't last a season, or worse, they begin to fail when many reading are required in a single stretch. Thus far, this instrument has out performed all the others this season. Of course, the season's not over yet. It comes with a nice protective field case that also hold the buffers, so onsite calibration is a snap. The only problem I've had is some of the new batteries I installed were bad... but that's not the instrument's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Glass sensor broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I'll just start by saying I'm extremely careful with my equipment. I was calibrating this before each use, after realizing that it was holding the calibration I went to calibrate once a week. I actually love this meter has a call so you can store in 3m KCl solution and comes with a nicely designed carrying case for a 2 point calibration. The aaa batteries was a huge plus for me as I expected this meter to last. Unfortunately the probe broke in less than 3 months. I'm not sure what caused the glass to break as it did not make direct contact with any solid object which justifies my 2 star review.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: Very good product until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I use the Apera PH tester for testing my fish tanks. I’m now on my 3rd Apera PH tester because the other two stopped working just about a year after I bought them. Each worked perfectly until the display started rapidly changing, to the point where you could no longer get a stable reading. I tried removing batteries, changing the storage solution, recalibrating, turning off my phone’s bluetooth, yet nothing helped. I will say when they worked, the display and the accuracy were very good.
customer_reviews.author: shfltchr

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the PH meters
customer_reviews.text: I had first bought one of those yellow economy pH meters for around $15 and it was a total waste of money because its readings were neither accurate nor stable. It would drift constantly in one direction as it remained submerged in solution. This one came in a very nice storage case with large vials of calibration solution, a laminated placard for quick reference, and a manual. It also arrived with moisture/liquid in the protective cap, thus keeping the sensor properly moistened during storage/shipment. I was absolutely delighted when I saw all these nice features as compared to the cheap chineze version which cost a third as much. I highly recommend this meter.
customer_reviews.author: Pdubja

customer_reviews.title: Best DECENT meter for the price
customer_reviews.text: If you need to know pH, this is a great meter to own. This is in fact my second purchase after I carelessly broke the first after a year and a half. (The old one was always spot on). To extend the life of your meter, buy some storage solution for when it is not in use and don't loan it to me. I calibrated the meter on receipt as is my custom and check it every few uses. (Which are daily). So far it has not strayed off calibration at all.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Will not calibrate
customer_reviews.text: Of all the PH meters I've used this is absolutely the worst to get calibrated. I've tried at least 10 times. I contacted Apera support and they said I need to have L M H in the bottom left of the screen, which I do. Calibrating 10 only does 9.8 so the readings are .2 off based on other meters and testing solutions. I do not recommend this product for salwater, not even sure I recommend for freshwater testing.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Jones

customer_reviews.title: Never buy this POS $10 meters again.
customer_reviews.text: Finally oh my dear lord finally after several cheap $10 ph meters didnt work (since the tds worked fine i assumed the oh $10 meter would too....nope apparently they are just a scam every single one read defriently with the same water after calibration junk. But this this is perfect does exactly what it says ph and temp readout and very easy to calibrate. And by testing it with pool liquid ph buffer and over 5 different phs the Apera was dead on every time. +or- .1 but thats as advertised. Great product thankyou for not making me spend triple on a Hanna or blue lab will update to see how this works over the next year.
customer_reviews.author: Ses

customer_reviews.title: Decent first impression.  READ AND FOLLOW the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Most negative reviews I've seen are from someone who obviously didn't read the instructions. They are a little challenging to follow due to the detail on first set up and calibration, but once you've done it PROPERLY, it's pretty simple to repeat. Based on anticipated readings, I'd say it's accurate, but obviously can't confirm how accurate without comparison testing. YOU MUST LET YOUR SAMPLES SIT FOR A FEW MINUTES FOR THE READING TO STABILIZE. Screen is easy to read with clear numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce W Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Not stable or accurate
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the package, this item could not calibrate or maintain a stable reading. The pH reading would jump significantly, even in the buffer solutions, and it wasn't even stable long enough to perform calibration. For example, within the 7.0 calibration buffer solution, the readings jumped to 1.2, 14.0, 5.4, 8.1. With fresh batteries, same result. I followed instructions and even watched youtube videos to ensure I was doing everything correctly.
customer_reviews.author: adam0789

customer_reviews.title: Quite Surprised with Apera PH20
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tester based upon all the reviews I was able to find on Goggle. After serious consideration , I chose the Apera PH20 . I was quite surprised to see how this item was packaged. It came with a sturdy case and had detailed instructions for its use. The unit appears to sturdy and well made also. The calibration was not as simple the first time through but I quickly learned the process after the second time. It appears to be quite accurate but with these handheld testers only time will tell. I think it is a great value for the money and I am quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a pH meter that is accurate and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I heartily recommend for purchase the Apera Instruments AI209 PH20 Value Waterproof pH Pocket Tester. This is the third pH tester that I've purchased this month. The other two, which were under $20, failed by the time I did three calibration checks. This one is sturdy, spot on accurate and ergonomically fits the hand. It's a no-brainer to operate. My only complaint is that the happy face that Apera uses to indicate when the pH test is successfully completed, is very tiny. Even with my reading glasses on, I could barely tell if the face was happy or sad. It's a minor thing that could be improved. I strongly recommend purchasing the Apera Instruments AI209 PH20 pH tester.
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Hitt

customer_reviews.title: Apera PH Meter
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and easy to calibrate. I did test the calibration and found that it was off for 7.0, it read 6.8. Very easy to correct and honestly was glad that I had a chance to calibrate it myself. Faster reading than the meter I replaced. My last meter took a little while to get an accurate reading and then I was never sure it was done reading. With this meter it takes seconds and then a smiley face to let you know it's done. When stored, the direction say to put a few drops of "tap water" in the cap so it won't dry out. Great! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kfab12

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple, easy to use for Hydroponic gardening in a nice storage case.
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to find scientific instruments at affordable prices for home and hobby users. I have owned this since 2017. This thing is easy to use. Just dip and stir to assure that water and nutrient/fertilizing solutions are at the correct pH. I will be trying to get a soil pH using the proper methodology (NO, you do NOT stick this thing directly in the dirt). Calibration is easy once you figure it out, but a little baffling before you do. Apera has a video that helps. Finally, it's a beautifully built instrument - good materials, professional looking.
customer_reviews.author: Nick i am

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my money on a $13 meter from an auction site. It wasn't user friendly, it wasn't accurate, it didn't work. After that, the price point became less important. this unit has a ton of positive reviews. I purchased it. In the hand, this thing feels like absolute quality. It couldn't have been easier to calibrate. It comes with 4.0 and 7.0 PH solutions to calibrate the unit. It comes in a hard-shell case and has a nicely laminated quick guide. Between the $13 meter, that I wasted my money on, and this, it's not even close. This thing is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mister B.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless. Waste of Money, Time & Effort.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are literally worthless, the display is God awful and for the price its highway robbery. calibration mode is broken and the calibration solutions do not work as described. the product is not accurate what so ever the only up side to this terrible device is the packaging but definitely not worth $50. what a waste and pain in the back. is a decent PH meter too much to ask for? who keeps making this garbage and who is approving it as well? absolute trash product, instructions and display. definitely seeking to return ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: Hudson Northcutt

customer_reviews.title: revieved a dry electrode
customer_reviews.text: *the seller had my first review removed* The Package came very promptly. The pen comes with a very cool carrying case and the design looks solid. Unfortunately mine arrived with the cap resivour, that is supposed to keep the glass electrode moist, empty. It looks like the storage liquid has leaked out prior to shipping as the carrying case it came in was not wet at all. On top of this the glass electrode is completely dried out. It looks to be only 1/3rd full. I will be seeking a replacement. Just be clear, the shipping process was fine. My experience with the probe is what this review references.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gately

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: Edit: Company agreed my unit was defective and sending a new one tomorrow. Good customer service and quick response. Hopefully this one works. Completely useless. During calibration mode my numbers fluctuate from 5.1 to 9.2. The weird thing is every time my hand goes near the meter without touching it the numbers spike. I really hope I received a defective unit. Either that or I have absolutely no idea how ph meters are supposed to work.
customer_reviews.author: jooooooooo

customer_reviews.title: Different readings on different PH 7 solution
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this! Initially, I loved it! However, I have my own ph 7 calibration solution at home and it is reading at 7.6, clearly not correct, my tap water is 7.4 and reading 7.8, and the solution it came with is reading at 7. I’m so confused at this point! Is it their calibration solution, or mine? Guess I’ll buy a third ph 7 solution and see what that reads at, will update. Can’t figure out how to contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: The Dawg Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent meter. I used one of the cheap yellow ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent meter. I used one of the cheap yellow meters for a few months but if you're actually serious about needing a pH meter for things like fermentation and hydroponics this WELL worth the extra money. Easy calibration and it has stayed calibrated so far with no issues. Quick readings, and I like the smiley face feature to let you know when there is a stable reading. I highly recommend this meter to anyone who does not want to spend a fortune for a professional pH meter but needs something better than the $15 yellow ones.
customer_reviews.author: Hanh

customer_reviews.title: Confusing instructions and arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived broken even though it had a slip inside verifying it was calibrated before shipping. The calibration instructions are clear as mud but after figuring them out the meter just didn’t work. Even when in the buffering solution it constantly went from 0-9 and everywhere in between
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: So ive had it for a few months and it works great i really like it alot. Ive only had to calibrate it one time when i got it and its been about 6 months, daily use, and it still registers 7.0 in the buffer solution. Ill occasionaly check it to make sure its still calibrated but so far so good. Ive went through every possible PH measurement system and if youve done it enough you know it can be really nightmarish. Not with this though, its so easy Its honestly kind of unbelievable lol So i definitely will buy another one if anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Henry <3

customer_reviews.title: Probe is Dead After 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: If you have a need for a pH meter that warrants spending as much as this thing costs, spend a little bit extra and get one with replaceable probes. I followed the storage and maintenance instructions to the letter and after about 100 uses the probe just gives "Err1" code when trying to calibrate. I opened a brand new bottle of calibration solution just to see if that was the issue; nope. This thing works well when it does work, but the probe wears out so fast it doesn't make any financial sense to buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: Extremely inaccurate even after calibration
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read but inaccurate as can be. Worked great, once. Calibrated with cooled, boiled water (distilled) and with the 7.0 & 4.0 solutions, read first pH cycle great. Second time was a little wonky, with my tap water ranging anywhere from 3.0-7.0. Needed an accurate reading the third time and was coming up with numbers in my tap water of 2.0, which is far more acidic than hydrochloric acid. So i boiled more water, let it cool, and re-calibrated with the 7.0/4.0 solutions, and first read of tap water was 1.7 and dropping. My finger would fall off at that level. Getting my money back today (hopefully).
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I was sent an obvious used meter. The batteries were already installed, the pH buffer solutions were only half full, and there was dust/dirt inside the case. EDIT: Apera saw this review and made it right. They sent me a new meter and it works well. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute crap. You're better off with the $10 yellow plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: not waterproof, went through 2 in a month. Absolute crap. You're better off with the $10 yellow plastic meters, mine has been working for 6 months compared to this expensive piece of sh*t. DONT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Sabella

customer_reviews.title: What I needed...
customer_reviews.text: After blowing through a few cheap PH testers that were crap and broke easily, I finally ponied up a few extra bucks for this one and boy am I glad I did. Sturdy, waterproof, and strong. Cheap testers you are to swirl the device in the water for 30 secs, this much better and more accurate. You take a sample of water in the cap, submerge the tester, and in a few seconds you have an accurate PH reading.
customer_reviews.author: SethS

customer_reviews.title: A really good basic digital pH pen
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a digital pH pen and this came recommended via various online forums. I'm removing 1 star as the setup could have had better documentation. My pen was off when I first received it and I had to use the calibration solution to fix it, which isn't a big deal. Now that I know what I'm doing, it's very simple to maintain this pen. I usually calibrate once every 2 weeks, but it's never off by much. If you're purchasing this pH pen, I recommend buying Apera storage solution as it doesn't come with it and it'll help extend the life of the pen. Overall, I'm pleased with this pH pen and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: The lcd screen is broke and the liquid bubbles when ...
customer_reviews.text: The lcd screen is broke and the liquid bubbles when pressing the on off button. Turned on twice as I was calibrating and now has failed. Amazon is sending another and once I prove what I believe is an superior instrument I will change rating. It does say something about quality control. Amazon / Shanghai Sanxon replaced te instrument and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Endeavor to perservere

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm not buying another one after maybe around 6 or 8 months I haven't used the new one cuz I found the tabs inside and you'll notice if you have it you might have to bend them back to make them contact the battery again it was turning itself off but once I did that I have not had a problem with it don't know why they bent but I have an extra one I would buy it again if I needed hopefully I don't need with the one I have and the one I have in stock
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: I have several ph testers and they all suck. But this one is nuts on EVERY TIME
customer_reviews.text: This instrument is THE one to get. I have several ph testers and they all suck. But this one is nuts on EVERY TIME. The devil is in the details right? So,this comes with a fitted dual latch case. Even better, the end cap doubles as the test cup. Not only that, it comes with enough test solution to last months (and due to the way they provide the test products) you can re use the solution. It is easy to calibrate and tells you on the display when your test is done. It costs twice as much as some other testers, but it is well worth it in plain peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten almost two years of good results with this Apera pH20 meter, which I use for monitoring the pH of my in-ground pool water. It's easy to use, holds calibration well, and is easy to calibrate when needed. I purchased bottles of buffer solution for calibration, and per Apera's instruction have begun using electrode storage solution. Aperas's customer service is excellent--courteous, pleasant people to deal with, and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first then it broke, but see update below, score changed
customer_reviews.text: Thisis product seems to be a good one, but it stopped working right in the first couple of months and we are outside of the 30 day policy so we have wasted our money. Update: Apera handles our return personally, expeditiously, and allowed us to upgrade to a product which will better suit our needs, along with FANTASTIC guidance and customer service. Apera WILL take care of you as a customer even if there are extenuating circumstances!!! Do NOT hesitate to buy from Apera, and if you have issues, contact them directly rather than dealing with AZN. Thanks a million Apera!!!! New pen is flawless!
customer_reviews.author: Pain free!

customer_reviews.title: Not cost effective enough
customer_reviews.text: I had tried many ways of measuring PH: digital PH readers, PH strips, PH test solutions, including this. I feel, the best is to use a combination of API’s PH test solutions: PH (6-7.8), PH high range (7.4-8.8) and PH wide range (5-9). This instrument works OK, but not as instant and reliable as the solutions, and more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Z&Z

customer_reviews.title: DON"T BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for two weeks now, and it has yet to stay calibrated (sometimes not for even one test) but it definitely has to be calibrated for every use...NOT WORTH THE TIME OR MONEY....and I don't write reviews....
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Meter
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Build quality seems high out of the box, gaskets at batteries and other sensitive areas are a nice addition for water and dust resistance, comes with a very nice storage case lined with foam padding, instructions and a visual reference card, comes with 2 bottles of calibration liquid 4pH and 7pH, comes with batteries. Cons: Only two calibration liquids you'll need to buy the third to have full pH range. Sometimes readings fluctuate but I think that is just a matter of how the probe actually operates so its not really a con. I'd recommend it, pricier than the cheap $10 meters, but makes up for it in spades.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: This is as close to an expensive scientific pH meter ...
customer_reviews.text: This is as close to an expensive scientific pH meter that I have ever used for the price category. I compare this pocket meter with our Lab pH meter at work every month when I calibrate the scientific-grade mettler-toledo pH meter we use at work and it is quite accurate though it might take a little longer for the reading to stabilize. I think that the manufacturer doesn't give detailed enough instructions on proper probe maintenance and storage. I always rinse the probe with Distilled water after use and store in 3M KCl solution. I have a feeling that many of the complaints in the reviews could be avoided if the manufacturer was more specific about the probe storage.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: will not calibrate
customer_reviews.text: I have tried countless number of times to calibrate this thing. I followed included instructions as well as you tube videos. Will not calibrate to 7. Doesn't calibrate past 4.8. Hopefully they will let me return it.
customer_reviews.author: pyoung

customer_reviews.title: So far Great pH Meter
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different ph probe brands over the past 2 years and this meter seems to be legit. #1 The probe feels very solid, good weight to it not flimsy at all. 2# Comes with a case and very good instructions with photos. It also comes with 2 ph testing solutions 4.0 and 7.0 Tip - Always be careful with the probe tip not to hit it against anything. Make sure to calibrate at least once every two weeks if there is heavy use, weekly might be better. Overall super solid product so far. Out of all the ph meters I’ve purchased this is the only ph meter that I have written a review for.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Parra

customer_reviews.title: Great pH pen
customer_reviews.text: This meter is great. I got it to replace one of the cheap 10 or 15 dollar ones. And I found out the cheaper ones were off the whole time. This meter is right on. It comes with the calibration solutions so you can keep it accurate at all times. I suggest getting some KCL solution by Apera to keep the sensor soaked while storing.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Huff 2316

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great deal & accurate what more can I say
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical if apera because I wasn't familiar with the brand tbh but these are actually really good ph pens, it comes with a nice lil box including calibration solutions 4.0 & 7.0, a lanyard etc. I got the apera ph20, been using it like 2 months now & it's been great. Calibrate monthly and its on point, I actually have used pens from Blue labs, Milwaukee, hanna etc & I'd put this up against any of them. Just great qualuty for the price
customer_reviews.author: Brittchelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had a minor issue with my pen, but the customer service was absolutely amazing. Michael was extremely fast with his replies and showed a willingness to help from the very first email. Overall great pen for $45, my next purchase will probably be one of their more expensive pens, but this one is great for what you pay!
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Great meter w/ nice case and instructions
customer_reviews.text: More than I expected. I enjoy this meter very much and I am glad that i picked this up over the yellow ph meters. I've been using the yellows previously and they're nothing like these. My complaint is there is no backlight. Otherwise it gives accurate readings and water temperatures as well. Great for hydroponics
customer_reviews.author: Tryer and DIYer

customer_reviews.title: The probe doesn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PH 20 in Jan of 18. I use it everyday for hydroponics. This is a great meter easy to use, read and calibrate. I took really good care of this meter, rinsed it after use, stored in solution, never dropped the meter or damaged the probe in any way. It only last a year before it wouldn't calibrate. Called the company and they were understanding and it was a month out of warranty, but they repaired it anyway. So I use it for another year and the same thing, won't calibrate. This is not a value meter it is a value trap, because it's only going to last 1 year if you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use only you get the calibration down
customer_reviews.text: If you take the time to read the instructions, its a pc of cake . The storage case is sturdy and the unit itself seems durable. After a few uses you'll get use to the digital read out. I'm doing a few more tests spaced out over a few wks just to check its accuracy but I;m happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: This meter is defective!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This ph meter came to me defective. No matter how many times I calibrate it, it reads 2.0-2.8 off. Used a blue labs pen meter vs mine and it was off. Both calibrated with two points. 7, and 4. It screwed up my garden. I’m pissed. Ended up feeding way too high acidic ph thinking I was at 7.3 and it was really 5.4. I lowered it. So.... I was actually bringing it down to 4.0-3.0 which is crazy low! This meter SUCKS or the sellers SUCK. DO NOT PURCHASE!! It’s a rip off. Unless they fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for the elegance you receive
customer_reviews.text: No problems so far. Product came calibrated, though the measurement seems to be 0.1 off even after recalibration with the buffer solution. It could be something I’m doing wrong, but it’s well noting. Other than that, it’s perfect. The case is beautiful and allows perfect storage without the meter rustling around, potentially damaging the probe. I plan to purchase again along with Apera’s other products.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality; Inclusive pH Meter for Lab Work
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use; this is the most complete and simple to operate pH digital test meter I have found that comes in a custom fit case -- It holds calibration points well and is accurate to within .1 -- Unlike others, the manufacturer also supplies enough 4.0/7.0 baseline solutions to get started -- does not comes with storage solution, so be sure to purchase this along with any 10.0 solution if 3-point reference checks are needed. Finally, this is one of the few meters on the market in this price range that not only uses AA batteries instead of button cells, but 4 batteries are supplied with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: It is the best.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on these cheap $20 knock off ph pens from Amazon with “5 star reviews”. Majority of those ratings are FAKE from SAME commenters. However, Apera instrument PH pen is the best I’ve used so far. After spending over $100 on several cheap ph pens, I decided to try this one. Hands down the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jayk

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this over Hanna and I have tried both
customer_reviews.text: Moved over to this instrument from Hanna checkers that died after 2 weeks to a month. So far this hasn't died or needed storage solution just cleaning with pure water. (distilled) It also sports a temperature read out and a little more then the simple Hanna tools. I recommend this over Hanna and I have tried both of Hannah's around this and they are the same price and I was disappointed. If you need an affordable PH checker this is your tool.
customer_reviews.author: Polymath

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and floats
customer_reviews.text: We kept using the cheap ones and would either drop them in the water or calibrate them constantly. This one has made it a full week without the need to be calibrated. it's accurate, which you wouldn't think would be a listed plus. haha we use it nightly and it just works.
customer_reviews.author: Amaizing Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great meter
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this meter. I use this for hydroponics.I used to use the Oakton EcoTestr pH 2 But their price keeps getting higher and the meters don't last as long or hold calibration like they used to.So I gave this one a shot. man what a great meter so far. has held a perfect calibration for a month strait.Ill update if it turns out bad but so far so good! Update 05/28/18 the first meter lasted about a years heavy use. Im happy so I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an upgrade to the cheap yellow pens.
customer_reviews.text: I'll update it if starts getting worse. Seems like a good pen so far. It's held up within 0.1 of every test I've done, including ph solutions from GH that I had on hand. Seems to do well being stored in 4.0 ph solution - that's what was recommended by the manufacturer in the booklet.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This instrument came in a very nice case with excellent instructions. It was somewhat challenging to learn to calibrate, but once one understands the process it is very simple. The meter read out similar readings that compared to the chemical ph tests I also used to test and "mirror" the results. I will be using the meter for testing gardening water and the ph levels in my hot tub. The test strips for the tub are fairly expensive, so this meter should pay for itself in short order.
customer_reviews.author: Langrila

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn’t sure about it until I calibrated it and tested my aquariums. I had bought a different ph tester and it was fluctuating up and down way too much. So I decided to buy this one, like I said “I wasn’t sure”. I also tested the calibration solution of that cheaper one and this one read it perfectly. Don’t waste your time on the cheaper one, it’s really hard to determine the ph color of a solution test. I couldn’t figure out if it was 7.4, 7.8 or 8.0 on the color scale on the high range ph. I’m pretty happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Se Sihongheune

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. I also calibrate it with the proper pH solutions every month. Easy to use, very well made, excellent operating instructions (including an illustrated laminated card. If I could add one improvement, it would be to have grippy ridges molded jnto the sides of the meter to minimize it slipping out of one's hand. The storage/carrying case is very well made also, with padded cut-outs to fit the instrument and two bottles of calibrating solution. This is a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions and it will work.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my purposes. However if you leave this device in the solution for too long it's reading seems to keep dropping. so believe the reading when the smile face indicator first appears. I know because I tested it with other PH testers. Remember to shake to bubbles off the probes each time you stick it in the solution.
customer_reviews.author: Larz

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great. So simple to use and calibrate. Holds calibration for quite a while but other then the initial testing, I calibrate every few uses just because I want to. The LCD screen is easy to read and the instructions that come with the kit are simple to follow and well thought out. Speaking of the kit, it has everything one needs to calibrate. Comes in a nice foam lined carrier as well. This Apera has proven to be accurate and reliable and I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Teebird

customer_reviews.title: Works as discribed. Quality device.
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this product for only a few days. I use it to check the PH level in my outdoor hot tub. Super easy to calibrate, comes in a nice case, and easy to get a correct PH reading. I had a lot of trouble determining the correct PH using colored test strip. This is a exactly what I needed. Happy with the purchase so far. Only negative - Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Best,affordable PH meter for hydroponics.
customer_reviews.text: Best PH meter I've used in over 15 years of hydroponic gardening. I seriously have owned over 20 PH meters from several different manufacturers and Apera is the absolute best. Recommended over any PH meters on the market, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Shaka's closet☢

customer_reviews.title: Not junk
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pen accurate and easy guy was saying the gasket they have em without gaskets and with the gasket it’s an oring and it will come off lost mine after 3 days found it put back on and have had no problems since except my plants are blowing up everywhere 3x what they were doing and I had a cheap meter(pen) I’m going to get a ph60 the ph20 doesn’t have a replaceable probe but is a nice pen is working great I just want the 60
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Best ph meter on market!
customer_reviews.text: Best pen next to Bluelab. Maybe even better because of price. Only problem is rubber gasket falls off from time to time. Not a big deal but should be looked at. This thing is legit if its yellow dont buy it, buy litmus until you can buy this! Trust me this is the one you want!
customer_reviews.author: FrankieBullfloats

customer_reviews.title: WHERE IS PH10 FOR CALIBRATION?
customer_reviews.text: Product came in wet like it has been used before, I’m also kind of confused with the calibration they stated to calibrate in the ph4 then ph7 and last is ph10... but I don’t see any ph10! So I don’t know what that’s about! If anyone can explain to me I would appreciate it :) I did the calibration everything seems fine so far with the exception of not being calibrated on the “wide” range.
customer_reviews.author: @Mr&MrsC

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as intended
customer_reviews.text: After using a cheaper product with much frustration I stepped up to this and am so glad that I did. It is sleek and feels high quality, has a very nice storage case, and comes with pre-mixed buffer. This was so easy to calibrate and get up and running. It holds accuracy and can be used time after time with confidence. Overally, well made product.
customer_reviews.author: dezzy

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I purchased this meter. First I purchased two of the bottom end meters. I calibrated both at the same time. Tested the same water with both, they were more than one half of a percentage off each other. This one came already on the mark, pH 7.0.
customer_reviews.author: Hogbender

customer_reviews.title: Yes you should get it instead of the China ones
customer_reviews.text: If you're here reading this because you're wondering if you should get this or one of those cheap China made ph meters the answer is buy this one. Trust me you'll kill your plants with those yellow budget meters.
customer_reviews.author: KNOW IT ALL

customer_reviews.title: Homemade wine makers rejoice.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once for its intended purchase. I use this to check ph in my homemade wine. Works quickly, and with the test liquids included in the kit, I'm 99% certain it's within+/- .1 accuracy. I can't help but wondering if I should have bought the same meter but in the kit with all the extra solutions.
customer_reviews.author: ren

customer_reviews.title: Calibration seems to drift a bit more than I would like - I still have to re-calibrate every few days ...
customer_reviews.text: It didnt work very well at first, but after soaking in 3M KCL solution for 24 hours its ok now. Calibration seems to drift a bit more than I would like - I still have to re-calibrate every few days to keep it within the +- .1 range - but its way better than the cheapo meters.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I could be wrong but this isn't what I expected to see when I opened this up for the first time. The cap was full of some white shreds and dust and something next to the clear sensor looks like it exploded. I have no idea what that even is or how that could have happened without the person packaging this noticing it. This is just really frustrating because it's the fourth pH sensor I've bought. The other were different brands but I thought for sure this more expensive one would surely be better quality... Turn out was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: And its water proof. I've been using it a couple of weeks. It seems solid. Numbers don't bounce around. Works in seconds. has a case comes with ph solutions to calibrate. So far so good . Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Underrated, under payed . First to succeed

customer_reviews.title: get this if you are on a budget/.
customer_reviews.text: same accuracy and durability as the ph60 for half the price. no the probe is not replaceable but if you take care of it, it should last years. Bought this as a back up for the ph60 we have.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Daytona

customer_reviews.title: Will purchase again when the time comes
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a pH meter before I am a soap and cosmetic maker this was recommended by another cosmetic and soap maker it is easy to use and I feel it is a wonderful product I would purchase again anytime
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Keep Exchanging until it turns out right.
customer_reviews.text: I have had to reorder this product for a third time now because it has had water damage and looks like it has been used, I have bought it new not used so I don't understand why it would be wet like it's been used.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great PH Pen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Works great. Wish I would have stopped buying the cheap yellow ones years ago. All around really nice and accurate ph pen. And case and calibration liquid is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recomend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this friggin ph pen. Just got my second one in the mail. Broke my first one , My bad ,broke the glass bubble in the tip. Borrowed a $15 one from my brother waiting on the new one. Let me tell you I feel sorry for the new hydroponics user Who uses a super cheap pH pen ,they are doomed from the start , I HATED IT! If the quality stays the same I will never buy a different pH pen ever!.........
customer_reviews.author: mike w

customer_reviews.title: This is a legit pH tester..
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed just about any cheap pH tester on Amazon has fake reviews, poor quality/resolution, short lifetime, and untrustworthy retailers. Although more expensive, these manufacturers make a fantastic product! It comes with buffer solution liquids that last for 1 year, with laminated instruction card, and a lanyard for nerds to wear it around their neck. That's some functional bling right there. Please don't buy cheap pH testers, it's worth it to get a quality product, such as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs calibrated every use!
customer_reviews.text: I use it every 3-5 days and it's always off by .1-.3 everytime. I double check with my prestige ph meter which stays spot on and I do calibrate them regularly that's how I know my prestige ph meter is more accurate. The apera ph meter need to be calibrated every time you use it if you want accuracy!
customer_reviews.author: mark h.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, quality meter that’s well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality WATERPROOF PH meter, that is very easy for the home gardener to set up, calibrate, and use in the garden, nursery, or grow room. It’s done exactly what it said it would and I absolutely recommend it over the cheap 10-15$ jobbers (of which I’ve been through @ least 4 of in the past year). An investment that will certainly pay for itself without the headache of having to order another cheapie
customer_reviews.author: jena

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT! I REPEAT DO NOT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 months ago. And the thing is already not working. Its frozen on 6.3 so I obviously can't use it to ph my water. Stay away from this ph meter. Im really upset.
customer_reviews.author: Jxdubbs

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate “Instrument”
customer_reviews.text: It calibrates fine and correctly but when you go to test water this thing is all over the place. Multiple samples from the same gallon of water read anywhere from 5.4 all the way up to 7.9. Seems to be no real accuracy here. The smiley face comes on but never stabilized on a hard value.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: I'm a home brewer, this unit seemed to work well after one use. I was aiming for 5.3 ph, and it measured 5.2 as expected. Seems accurate and is easy to use. I've o LG used it once at this point but so far so good. Comes with a nice plastic storage case
customer_reviews.author: Paul N. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the cheapies
customer_reviews.text: I like others 1st tried the inexpensive pH testers. Once I suspected an issue & replaced it with this guy, things are looking much better. When I compared the 2 after mixing there was a huge difference at the desired range.
customer_reviews.author: TheCaveMan

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery, high quality and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The new Apera tester was delivered in 1 day! It comes in a high quality case that also includes the calibration buffers. A laminated card is included with calibration instructions. I have used many different meters over the years and this one was as easy to calibrate as my previous Hanna. Readings stabilize In a reasonable amount of time and are accurate. Just getting started with it so time will tell as to how long the probe lasts but at this point I have only positive things to say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One year of dependable readings
customer_reviews.text: This pH tester has served me well for one year as of the writing of this review. For those new to using a pH tester, it is critical that the sensor be rinsed in clean distilled water after every use. If you don't do this the pH readings will vary substantially.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph & Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Calibrate before first use.
customer_reviews.text: This meter is easy to calibrate and seems to hold it's calibration from storage to use. I would recommend calibrating before using the first time. The only complaint I have at this time is receiving my meter with a broken case latch. That was disappointing, but I didn't feel returning it was appropriate since the meter is functional. However for the price a better case would be more desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Best pH pen I've ever used. Great quality and price!
customer_reviews.text: Great pH pen! I've used a couple in the past and this one is by far the best. Simple calibration, quality design and very accurate. Comes with two pH buffer solutions, a lanyard, and a quality carrying case. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: SAA_Gunslinger

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a pH pen, well stop looking and get this one!
customer_reviews.text: This pH meter has blown me away. Not only was it extremely easy to calibrate, but it reads incredibly accurately as well! I had many of those cheap pH meters, but one by one they would break, or stop being accurate. So I finally decided to buy a more expensive one, and boy am I so happy I did!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Treez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far this meter has been an excellent and much needed upgrade from the plastic yellow one I bought. This comes with calibration fluid and seems consistently accurate to me.
customer_reviews.author: Number 1
